Instruction.1: Stand with a barbell at your shins with your feet shoulder width apart.
Instruction.2: Bend forward at your hips and keep your knees as fully extended as possible.
Instruction.3: Grab the barbell and then extend your hips while maintaining a straight back.
Instruction.4: From the standing position, lower the weight in a controlled manner.
Instruction.5: You can either lower the weight to the floor or before you touch the floor, depending on your mobility.

Instruction.1: Place the bar on your traps. You may need a pad so the bar doesn't dig into your cervical spine.
Instruction.2: Push your hips straight back. Your knees should stay MOSTLY extended (think soft knees). Also make sure to
Instruction.3: Look for what feels like a stretch in your hamstrings. The stretch feeling means you're likely nearing the end of your Range of Motion without rounding your spine.
Instruction.4: When you feel the stretch push your hips forward until you're in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Place the bar between your traps and rear delts. Pull your shoulder blades back to give the bar a shelf to sit on.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. This means you're nearing the end of your Range of Motion with out rounding your spine.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch push your hips forward until you'e in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Take a shoulder width, double overhand or mixed grip.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with your toes pointed slightly outward.
Instruction.2: Place a barbell on the floor in front of you, with the weight plates on either side. Make sure that the bar is directly in line with your feet.
Instruction.3: Bend down and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands much wider than shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight and your shoulders down as you grip the bar.
Instruction.4: Stand up straight, lifting the barbell off the ground and pulling it toward your hips. Keep your elbows close to your body and your shoulders down as you do this.
Instruction.5: Slowly lower the barbell back to the ground, making sure to keep your back straight and your shoulders down throughout the movement.

Instruction.1: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart. The bar should be in a rack or box so it's lifted off the ground.
Instruction.2: Grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands should be much wider than shoulder-width apart.
Instruction.3: Hing forward at the hips keeping your knees mostly extended. Hinge until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.4: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you are back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Begin by standing with your feet about hip-width apart and holding a barbell in the crook of your elbows, with your palms facing towards your body.
Instruction.2: Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and lower your torso forward until it is nearly parallel to the ground.
Instruction.3: Push through your heels to extend your hips and raise your body back to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and holding a barbell at one side of your body, with your palms facing your thighs.
Instruction.2: Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and knees to lower the barbell down towards the ground.
Instruction.3: As the barbell reaches the ground, use your legs and glutes to push through your heels and extend your hips and knees to raise your body back to the starting position.
Instruction.4: Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with the barbell on the opposite side of your body.

Instruction.1: Stand in front of the landmine with your feet hip-width apart and your knees slightly bent. Grasp the landmine barbell with both hands, palms facing each other, and hold it in front of your thighs.
Instruction.2: Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, hinge at the hips and push your hips back, allowing the landmine to travel down your thighs. Lower the landmine by bending forward at the hips while keeping your back flat, allowing the barbell to move closer to the floor. Continue the movement until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, keeping your legs relatively straight but with a slight bend in the knees.
Instruction.3: Reverse the movement by pushing your hips forward and driving through your heels while keeping your back straight.
Instruction.4: Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Instruction.1: Grab the end of the landmine and stand perpendicular to the bar.
Instruction.2: Lift your inside leg and keep your outside leg planted.
Instruction.3: Push your hips back keeping your knees mostly extended. When you feel the stretch in your hams, push your hips forward until you are standing upright.

Instruction.1: Stand in a staggered position. With the back leg bent and the front mostly extended.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back until you feel a stretch through your front hamstring.
Instruction.3: Push your hips back forward until you are standing.

Instruction.1: Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart with the bar on the ground at your side.
Instruction.2: Lift the bar to your side and walk for the allotted amount of time or distance.
Instruction.3: Set the bar down and switch sides.

Instruction.1: Lay down on the machine, placing your legs beneath the padded lever. Position your legs so that the padded lever is below your calve muscles.
Instruction.2: Support yourself by grabbing the side handles of the machine, and slowly raise the weight with your legs, toes pointed straight.
Instruction.3: Pause at the apex of the motion, then slowly return to starting position.

Instruction.1: Position yourself on a glute ham raise machine or find a suitable substitute like a stability ball or bench.
Instruction.2: Adjust the equipment to fit your body by setting the footplate at an appropriate height and making sure your feet are securely anchored.
Instruction.3: Begin the movement by slowly lowering your upper body towards the ground while keeping your torso and legs aligned.
Instruction.4: Once you reach the lowest point where your body is parallel to the ground or as far as you can comfortably go, pause briefly.
Instruction.5: Engage your glutes and hamstrings again as you push yourself back up to the starting position, using the strength of your posterior chain muscles.

Instruction.1: Sit on the machine. Adjust the back pad to where the leg pad is just above your knees.
Instruction.2: Adjust the leg pad that goes on your lower leg until it's on your achilles.
Instruction.3: Use the two handles to push your self back in the chair. Curl your legs as far as possible, and then extend your knees. (Do not hyperextend)

Instruction.1: Sit back in the seat. Use the two handles to push yourself back into the chair.
Instruction.2: Flex your ankles and point your toes upward.
Instruction.3: Flex your knee bringing the pad backward, extend your knee without allowing the weight to touch back down.

WorkoutName: Machine Plate Loaded Kneeling Hamstring Curl

Instruction.1: Lay down on the machine, placing your working leg beneath the padded lever. Position your leg so that the padded lever is below your calve muscle.
Instruction.2: Support yourself by grabbing the side handles of the machine, and slowly raise the weight with your legs.
Instruction.3: Pause at the apex of the motion, then slowly return to starting position.

Instruction.1: Lay on the pad and grab the handles.
Instruction.2: Slip your legs into the belt loop.
Instruction.3: Push your legs back until they are horizontal with the ground.
Instruction.4: Lower back to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Press yourself into the pads and put your calves against the lower pads.
Instruction.2: Flex your knee until you feel a contraction in your hamstring, then lower back to the start.

Instruction.1: Adjust the back pad and ankle pad to suit your height.
Instruction.2: Disengage the knee pad and lower it as far as you can.
Instruction.3: Flex your knees against resistance, then extend until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.

Instruction.1: Sit on the floor with your legs out in front of you.
Instruction.2: Reach forward to try and touch your toes. Reach as far forward as you can go.
Instruction.3: Hold the stretch for a few seconds then return to starting position.

Instruction.1: Sit on the floor with one leg outstretched and the other bent at the knee, foot resting on the opposite inner thigh.
Instruction.2: Reach forward to touch the toes of the outstretched leg.
Instruction.3: Hold the stretch for a few seconds then return to starting position.

Instruction.1: Stand with one foot in front of the other.
Instruction.2: Bend your rear leg as much as you can, keeping the front leg straight.
Instruction.3: Hold the stretch for a few seconds then return to starting position.

Instruction.1: Lie down with your legs reaching up the wall. your bum should be slightly off the floor.
Instruction.2: Bend one leg and leave the other outstretched.
Instruction.3: Push your thigh towards the wall.
Instruction.4: Hold the stretch for a few seconds then return to starting position.

WorkoutName: Plate Single Leg Pinch Grip Deadlift

Instruction.1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and facing forwards. Grip the sides of a weight plate with your palms facing down.
Instruction.2: Balance on one foot, as you raise the weight keep your arms and back straight, while you bring your  other foot back towards the ground
Instruction.3: Keep four raised leg straight and in alignment with your back as you lower the plate back down to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Engage your core and straighten your legs to lift the plate off the ground.
Instruction.2: Stand on one leg, keeping the other leg off the ground, while holding the plate in front of your body.
Instruction.3: Keep your back straight and maintain a neutral head position while looking straight ahead.
Instruction.4: Lower the plate back down to the ground while keeping your balance on one leg.

Instruction.1: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a weight plate.
Instruction.2: Place one foot slightly behind the other, with the heel of your back foot elevated.
Instruction.3: From this starting position, bend at the hips and knees to lower the plate towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Instruction.4: Once the plate is below your knees, drive through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding two plates with a pinch grip.
Instruction.2: Place one foot slightly behind the other, with the heel of your back foot elevated.
Instruction.3: From this starting position, bend at the hips and knees to lower the plates towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.

Instruction.1: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate held behind the neck and the knees slightly bent.
Instruction.2: Bend forward at the hips, keeping the back straight, until the torso is parallel to the floor.
Instruction.3: Push through the hips to return to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate held in front of you, and the knees slightly bent.
Instruction.2: Bend forward at the hips, keeping the back straight, until the torso is parallel to the floor.
Instruction.3: Push through the hips to return to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate in front of the feet, and the knees slightly bent.
Instruction.2: Bend the hips and knees to grip the plate with palms facing the body.
Instruction.3: Keeping the back straight, stand up while lifting the plate off the ground.
Instruction.4: Return the plate back to the starting position by bending the hips and knees, keeping control of the plate.

Instruction.1: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar.
Instruction.2: Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time.
Instruction.3: Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring.
Instruction.4: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell. Hold a plate up to your chest.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time.
Instruction.2: Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Take a shoulder width, double overhand or mixed grip.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Stance width can vary with a sumo DL. Some prefer toes near the plates. Others prefer a more narrow stance to get more drive off the floor.
Instruction.2: Make sure your arms are inside your legs. The bar should be just over your mid-foot. Flatten your back and unrack the bar
Instruction.3: Leave your knees mostly extended and flex and extend your hips.

Instruction.1: Hold the dumbbell in a goblet position. With your elbows directly under your fists.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knees MOSTLY extended. You should feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Stand with a shoulder width stance. Push your butt back while leaving your knees MOSTLY extended.
Instruction.2: You should feel a stretch in your hamstrings. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward to complete the rep.
Instruction.3: Do not push your hips all the way forward. This will hyperextend your spine. Just go to a normal standing position.

Instruction.1: Lay flat on a bench with a dumbbell between your feet.
Instruction.2: Flex your knees and raise the dumbbell until the soles of your shoes are pointed at the ceiling.

WorkoutName: Dumbbell Single Leg Single Arm Deadlift

Instruction.1: Start by standing on one leg with a dumbbell in one hand.
Instruction.2: Slowly bend at the hips and lower the dumbbell towards the ground while extending your free leg behind you.
Instruction.3: Keep your core engaged and your back straight as you lower the weight.
Instruction.4: Once the dumbbell is close to the ground, push through your heel to return to the starting position.

WorkoutName: Dumbbell Single Leg Stiff Leg Deadlift

Instruction.1: Start by standing on one leg with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding two dumbbells.
Instruction.2: From this starting position, hinge at the hips to lower the dumbbell towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Instruction.3: Once you feel a stretch in your hamstring, slowly return to the starting position.
Instruction.4: Make sure to keep your standing leg slightly bent and avoid rounding your back as you lower the dumbbell.

Instruction.1: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Instruction.2: Place one foot slightly behind the other, with the heel of your back foot elevated on a step or weight plate.
Instruction.3: From this starting position, bend at the hips and knees to lower the dumbbells towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Instruction.4: Once the dumbbells are below your knees, drive through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in both hands.
Instruction.2: Bend your knees slightly and hinge at the hips to swing the dumbbell between your legs.
Instruction.3: From this starting position, explosively extend your hips and swing the dumbbell up to chest height.
Instruction.4: Allow the momentum of the swing to carry the dumbbell back down between your legs, and then repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Instruction.1: Lay flat on the ground with both feet planted. Make sure you keep your heels glued to the floor.
Instruction.2: Place the dumbbell on your hips. Push your hips toward the ceiling until you feel your glutes contract.
Instruction.3: Then return to the floor.

Instruction.1: Stand with a shoulder width stance holding one dumbbell. Push your butt back while leaving your knees MOSTLY extended.
Instruction.2: Reach toward the opposing leg. You should feel a stretch in your hamstrings. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward to complete the rep.
Instruction.3: Do not push your hips all the way forward. This will hyperextend your spine. Just go to a normal standing position.

Instruction.1: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar.
Instruction.2: Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time.
Instruction.3: Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring.
Instruction.4: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

WorkoutName: Dumbbell Half Kneeling Goblet Romanian Deadlift

Instruction.1: Place one knee on a bench and hold a dumbbell in a goblet position.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Place one knee on a bench and hold a dumbbell.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Hold medicine ball while standing on one leg.
Instruction.2: Hinge forward on one leg, extending other leg behind.
Instruction.3: Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.

Instruction.1: Start with a straight bar or ez bar attachment set to the bottom of the machine. Squat the weight up into a standing position and walk a few steps back
Instruction.2: Push your butt back to initiate the movement and then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position.
Instruction.3: To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back on any exercise.

Instruction.1: Start with a straight bar or easy bar attachment. Squat the weight up into a standing position and walk a few steps back.
Instruction.2:
Push your butt back to initiate the movement while lifting one of your legs.
Then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position.
Instruction.3: Compete your given amount of reps, then switch to opposite leg.
Instruction.4: To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back.

Instruction.1: This exercise works best with a rope attachment but can be done with anything. The attachment should be set to the bottom of the machine.
Instruction.2:
Face away from the cable machine, straddle the cable itself, and grab the attachment.
Walk a few steps away.
Instruction.3: Break at the hips while maintaining a flat back and mostly extended knees.
Instruction.4: Push hips forward until you are back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Use an ankle attachment with the cable set all the way to the bottom of the machine.
Instruction.2: Stand upright or try bending slightly forward.
Instruction.3: Flex at the knee and pull your ankle straight back.

Instruction.1: Start with a straight bar attachment set to the bottom of the machine. Squat the weight up into a standing position and walk a few steps back.
Instruction.2: Stand with a staggered stance. Push your butt back to initiate the movement and then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position.
Instruction.3: To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back on any exercise.

Instruction.1: Start with handles set to the bottom of the machine. Grab a box, stand on top of the box, squat the weight up into a standing position.
Instruction.2: Push your butt back to initiate the movement and then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position.
Instruction.3: To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back on any exercise.

Instruction.1: Bring a bench over to the cable stack, put the cable at head height (when seated). Use an ankle attachment.
Instruction.2: Sit on the bench.
Instruction.3: Flex at the knee and pull your ankle straight back.

WorkoutName: Cable Single Leg Laying Leg Curl

Instruction.1: Bring a bench over to the cable stack, put the cable all the way at the bottom. Use an ankle attachment.
Instruction.2: Lay on the bench.
Instruction.3: Flex at the knee and pull your ankle straight back.

Instruction.1: Begin by standing with your feet about hip-width apart and holding the bar in the crook of your elbows, with your palms facing towards your body.
Instruction.2: Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and lower your torso forward until it is nearly parallel to the ground.
Instruction.3: Push through your heels to extend your hips and raise your body back to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Start by facing the TRX straps and positioning yourself in a push-up position with your hands on the ground and your feet in the TRX foot cradles.
Instruction.2: Keeping your core engaged and body in a straight line, bend your knees and bring your heels towards your glutes.
Instruction.3: Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Take an overhand grip.
Instruction.2: Keep your knees mostly extended and hinge forward at the hips.
Instruction.3: Keep a flat back.

Instruction.1: Hold medicine ball while standing on one leg.
Instruction.2: Hinge forward on one leg, extending other leg behind.
Instruction.3: Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.

Instruction.1: Place one foot firmly on the ground and one foot behind the other. Bend the knee on your back leg.
Instruction.2: Hinge forward until you feel a stretch in your front leg.

Instruction.1: Stand up straight with a good form.
Instruction.2: Send your hips back and start tilting the upper body.
Instruction.3: Maintain a straight back as you aim for your toes.
Instruction.4: Your range depends on your hamstring flexibility.

Instruction.1: Place a massage ball on a bench.
Instruction.2: Sit on the ball with your hamstring.
Instruction.3: Move around till you find a tight/sore spot.
Instruction.4: Extend and bend your knee to mobilise the hamstring.

Instruction.1: Standing, split stance.
Instruction.2: Dynamically kick your back leg forward and up.
Instruction.3: Return to starting position.

Instruction.1: Lie on your back with straight legs.
Instruction.2: Perform a posterior pelvic tilt and maintain the position.
Instruction.3: Kick one leg up to feel a stretch in the hamstring.

WorkoutName: Hamstring Stretch Seated Single Leg Isometric

Instruction.1: Sit against a wall.
Instruction.2: Bend one leg and tuck the foot by the straight leg's knee.
Instruction.3: Dynamically reach forward towards your toes and return to starting position.

WorkoutName: Hamstring Stretch Static Standing Single Leg

Instruction.1: From the standing position, bring one leg slightly forward.
Instruction.2: Raise your toes and lean over towards them.
Instruction.3: Maintain the position.

Instruction.1: Place a theraband or stretch strap around your foot.
Instruction.2: Lie back onto the ground.
Instruction.3: Raise your leg to stretching point with the aid of the band (strap).
Instruction.4: Tug onto the strap on the end of range to dynamically stretch the hamstring.

Instruction.1: Place a theraband around your foot.
Instruction.2: Lie back onto the ground.
Instruction.3: Raise your leg to stretching point with the aid of the band, keeping a slightly bent knee.
Instruction.4: Extend and bend your knee to actively stretch your hamstring.

Instruction.1: Place a theraband or stretch strap around your foot.
Instruction.2: Lie back onto the ground.
Instruction.3: Raise your leg to stretching point with the aid of the band (strap).
Instruction.4: Tug onto the strap on the end of range to dynamically stretch the hamstring.

Instruction.1: Place a box behind you and one foot on it. Keep your chest up and the back straight
Instruction.2: Tilt at the hips to perform a deadlift. Use the box for balance and support
Instruction.3: Make sure you straighten your back leg when performing the deadlift.
Instruction.4: As you get comfortable with the movement, try to lift the leg off the box when you reach the end range of the deadlift.

Instruction.1: Stand tall, hinge at hips, and reach hands to the floor.
Instruction.2: Walk hands forward into a plank position.
Instruction.3: Walk feet towards hands and repeat the motion.

Instruction.1: Stand with your feet a little past shoulder width apart with a slight bend at your knee. Place your hands behind the back of your head.
Instruction.2: Keeping your back straight, rotate your hips to bring your shoulders down towards the floor. Stop when your chest is parallel with the floor.

Instruction.1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent and raise one leg.
Instruction.2: Without changing the bend in your knee, bend at your hips, and lower your torso until it's almost parallel to the floor.
Instruction.3: Tense your glutes and then bring yourself back to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Go to your knees and ask someone to hold your ankles.
Instruction.2: Put your hands in front of you
Instruction.3: With a slight bend in your knees slowly bring your body to the ground (slower is better)
Instruction.4: Push up and reset to the starting position.

Instruction.1: Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.
Instruction.2: Push through your right heel to return to standing, bringing your left leg back to starting position.
Instruction.3: Repeat the movement on the other side, stepping backwards with your right leg and lowering your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground and your left knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.

Instruction.1: Lie on your back with knees slightly bent and heels dug in.
Instruction.2: Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back on the ground).
Instruction.3: Press the heels into the ground to raise your hips off it.
Instruction.4: Hold the position for the specified duration.

WorkoutName: Hamstring Bridge With Elevated Legs Box Bilateral

Instruction.1: Lie on your back. Place your heels on a box or bench, having a 90° angle at hips and knees.
Instruction.2: Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground).
Instruction.3: Push through your heels into the box, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees.

WorkoutName: Hamstring Bridge With Elevated Legs Box Unilateral

Instruction.1: Lie on your back. Place one heel on a box or bench, having a 90° angle at hip and knee.
Instruction.2: Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground).
Instruction.3: Push through your heel into the box, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees.

Instruction.1: Lie on your back keeping both knees bent.
Instruction.2: Have a slider under the heel of the working leg.
Instruction.3: Extend and bend the working lag applying gentle downwards pressure.

Instruction.1: Lie on your back with bent knees and heels on a slider.
Instruction.2: Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back on the ground).
Instruction.3: Press the heels into the ground to raise your hips off it.
Instruction.4: Extend and bend the working leg.

Instruction.1: Bend your knees so your feet are flat on the floor with heels under knees and toes raised.
Instruction.2: Place sliders under your heels. Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground).
Instruction.3: Push through your heels into the ground, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees.
Instruction.4: Extend your legs in a slow, controlled manner, to lower your bum to the ground.

Instruction.1: Stand up straight using a balancing aid.
Instruction.2: Shift your weight on one leg.
Instruction.3: Bend and extend the non-weight bearing leg.
Instruction.4: Knees should remain aligned.

Instruction.1: Stand up straight using a balancing aid.
Instruction.2: Shift your weight on one leg.
Instruction.3: Bend the non-weight bearing leg and hold.
Instruction.4: Knees should remain aligned.

Instruction.1: Lie on your back with slightly bent knees and heels on sliders.
Instruction.2: Pull your heels towards your glutes to lift your hips off the ground.
Instruction.3: Extend knees to starting position, but do not rest hips on ground.

Instruction.1: Hold on to something stable and pull the leg on the opposing side straight up. Hold this position.
Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar.
Instruction.2: Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time.
Instruction.3: Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring.
Instruction.4: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Lie face-down on a stability ball, hips centered, feet anchored, hands behind your head.
Instruction.2: Engage your core, lift your upper body until aligned with legs, keeping your neck neutral.
Instruction.3: Lower your torso slowly back to the starting position, maintaining control and steady breathing.

Instruction.1: Lie on your back, heels on a stability ball, arms flat, and core engaged.
Instruction.2: Lift hips, curl the ball toward you using your hamstrings, keeping control and balance.
Instruction.3: Extend legs back to start while keeping hips lifted, then repeat for desired reps.

Instruction.1: Lie face down on a stability ball, hands on the floor, legs extended straight.
Instruction.2: Engage glutes and lower back, raising legs until aligned with your torso.
Instruction.3: Slowly lower legs back down without touching the ground, maintaining core engagement. Repeat.

Instruction.1: Place one knee on a bench.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.
Instruction.2: Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.
Instruction.3: Return to standing position and repeat.

Instruction.1: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell between your legs, with your knees slightly bent.
Instruction.2: Keeping your back straight, swing the kettlebell upwards until the kettlebell is level with your chest and carefully lower.
Instruction.3: Repeat

Instruction.1: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, lifting one foot off the floor behind you. Hold the kettlebell in the same arm as the lifted leg.
Instruction.2: Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you extend your lifted leg behind you, keeping your back straight - holding out your arm to the side for balance.
Instruction.3: Return to the upright position and repeat.

Instruction.1: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, shifting one foot behind you. Hold the kettlebell in both hands in front of your thighs.
Instruction.2: Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees and keep your back straight.
Instruction.3: Return to the upright position and repeat.

Instruction.1: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your chest.
Instruction.2: Bend forward at the hips keeping your back and knees straight and the kettlebell close to your chest.
Instruction.3: Return to standing position and thrust your pelvis forward.

Instruction.1: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs.
Instruction.2: Hinge at hips, swing kettlebell between legs.
Instruction.3: Swing kettlebell up, switch hands at the top, and repeat in a fluid motion.

Instruction.1: Stand with feet hip-width apart.
Instruction.2: Bend at hips and knees to lift kettlebells.
Instruction.3: Stand tall, then lower.

Instruction.1: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebells outside legs
Instruction.2: Hinge at hips, swing kettlebells forward, then back.
Instruction.3: Thrust hips to swing kettlebells upward, keeping arms straight.

Instruction.1: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs.
Instruction.2: Hinge at hips, grip kettlebell, and swing it overhead.
Instruction.3: Extend hips and knees, lock out arms at the top.

Instruction.1: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding kettlebells in front.
Instruction.2: Hinge at hips, keeping back straight, and lower kettlebells towards ground.
Instruction.3: Return to start position, squeezing glutes at the top.

Instruction.1: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs, grip with one hand, hinge at hips.
Instruction.2: Swing kettlebell forcefully forward, using hip thrust, arm straight.
Instruction.3: Swing kettlebell back between legs, repeat for desired reps.

Instruction.1: Begin with feet hip-width apart, one foot forward, kettlebell between feet.
Instruction.2: Hinge at hips, grip kettlebell, and stand tall.
Instruction.3: Lower kettlebell with control, then repeat.

Instruction.1: Lower kettlebell with control, then repeat.
Instruction.2: Explosively thrust hips forward, swing kettlebell to chest height.
Instruction.3: Repeat for desired reps, keeping core engaged and maintaining a staggered stance for balance.

Instruction.1: Start with a kettlebell between your legs, hinge at hips, swing it upward.
Instruction.2: Lift kettlebell to chest level, elbows high, engaging shoulders.
Instruction.3: Lower kettlebell back down, maintaining control. Repeat for desired reps.

Instruction.1: Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and holding a kettlebell at one side of your body, with your palms facing your thighs.
Instruction.2: Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and knees to lower the kettlebell down towards the ground.
Instruction.3: As the kettlebell reaches the ground, use your legs and glutes to push through your heels and extend your hips and knees to raise your body back to the starting position.
Instruction.4: Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with the kettlebell on the opposite side of your body.

Instruction.1: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar.
Instruction.2: Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time.
Instruction.3: Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring.
Instruction.4: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

WorkoutName: Kettlebell Half Kneeling Goblet Romanian Deadlift

Instruction.1: Place one knee on a bench and hold a kettlebell in a goblet position.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Place one knee on a bench and hold a kettlebell.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.3: When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Anchor the band at hip level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Instruction.2: Push your hips back while keeping your back flat until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.

Instruction.1: Anchor the band to the lowest point possible. Straddle the band and then grab with both hands.
Instruction.2: Take a few steps away until the band is taut.
Instruction.3: Push your butt back until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. Then extend the hips back into the starting position.

Instruction.1: Stand on your band with both feet.
Instruction.2: Hinge forward at the hips while keeping a flat back.
Instruction.3: Hinge until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
Instruction.4: Push your hips back forward until you are in a standing position.

Instruction.1: Loop the band around a sturdy anchor point such as a weightlifting rack or a door handle.
Instruction.2: Lie on your back with your heels placed inside the band. Make sure the band is centered under your heels and your feet are hip-width apart.
Instruction.3: Using your hamstrings, curl your heels towards your glutes while keeping your hips on the ground.

Instruction.1: Start in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the floor.
Instruction.2: Step your right foot forward, placing it between your hands.
Instruction.3: Straighten your right leg and flex your toes towards your face, keeping your hands on the floor for support.
Instruction.4: Hold for several breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

Instruction.1: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
Instruction.2: Inhale and lengthen your spine, then exhale and fold forward from your hips, keeping your spine long.
Instruction.3: Reach for your feet or ankles, keeping your elbows straight.
Instruction.4: Hold for several breaths, then release.

Instruction.1: Begin in Tadasana (Mountain Pose).
Instruction.2: Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and place your heel down, keeping your toes pointing forward.
Instruction.3: Inhale and lengthen your spine, then exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands to the floor on either side of your right foot.
Instruction.4: Hold for several breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

Instruction.1: Begin in Tadasana (Mountain Pose) with two blocks at the top of your mat.
Instruction.2: Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and place your heel down, keeping your toes pointing forward.
Instruction.3: Place the blocks on either side of your right foot at a height that allows you to comfortably place your hands on them.
Instruction.4: Inhale and lengthen your spine, then exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands to the blocks. Hold for several breaths, then switch sides and repeat.

Instruction.1: Stand with your feet hip-width apart.
Instruction.2: Hinge forward at your hips, reaching your hands towards the ground.
Instruction.3: Allow your head to hang heavy and feel a stretch in the back of your legs.
Instruction.4: Hold for a few breaths and then slowly roll up to a standing position.

Instruction.1: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place a block on the ground in front of you.
Instruction.2: Hinge forward at your hips and place your hands on the block.
Instruction.3: Allow your head to hang heavy and feel a stretch in the back of your legs.
Instruction.4: Hold for a few breaths and then slowly roll up to a standing position.

Instruction.1: Start in mountain pose, standing with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
Instruction.2: Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet and raise it off the ground, while keeping your right foot facing forward.
Instruction.3: Inhale and reach your arms forward, parallel to the ground.
Instruction.4: Exhale and hinge forward at your hips, bringing your torso parallel to the ground and extending your left leg straight back. Keep your arms and right leg straight and hold the pose for a few breaths
Instruction.5: inhale and return to mountain pose. Repeat on the other side.

WorkoutName: Wide Legged Standing Forward Bend Holding Heels

Instruction.1: Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart.
Instruction.2: Start standing at the top of your mat with your feet wide apart.
Instruction.3: Exhale and fold forward from your hips, bringing your hands up and over your head towards the ground.
Instruction.4: Hold for a few breaths and then release the hands and come back up to standing.

Instruction.1: Get the treadmill up to a comfortable speed where you are doing a light jog.
Get the treadmill up to a speed where you are doing a sprint.
Get the treadmill up to a comfortable speed where you are doing a walk.
Perform s sprint in a figure eight pattern.
Instruction.2: Make sure to stay low.

Instruction.1: Start with a shoulder width stance.
Instruction.2: Stay on your toes, step right, tap your left toe to the ground, plant your right foot and raise your left leg.
Instruction.3: Then repeat in the opposite direction.

Instruction.1: Stand straight, feet hip-width apart, engage core.
Instruction.2: Lift knees alternately, tap with same side hand.
Instruction.3: Continue rhythmically, maintain posture, increase speed as able.

Instruction.1: Stand tall, jog in place, bringing heels toward your glutes.
Instruction.2: Keep your core tight and swing arms naturally.
Instruction.3: Alternate legs quickly, maintaining a steady rhythm.
